title: Ticket #1093: condor_status default sorting broken in 7.4
description:
condor_status is now sorting output based on the "Name" attribute, not the "machine" attribute. So, output can look like this: 

$ condor_status | egrep chevre\|charlie
slot1@charlie.cs.w LINUX      X86_64 Claimed   Idle     0.000  1965  0+00:03:01
slot1@chevre.cs.wi LINUX      X86_64 Owner     Idle     0.000  1945  0+01:20:28
slot2@charlie.cs.w LINUX      X86_64 Claimed   Idle     0.000  1965  0+00:00:05
slot2@chevre.cs.wi LINUX      X86_64 Owner     Idle     0.000  1945  0+01:20:29
slot3@charlie.cs.w LINUX      X86_64 Claimed   Busy     0.160  1965  0+00:00:06
slot3@chevre.cs.wi LINUX      X86_64 Owner     Idle     0.070  1945  0+01:20:30
slot4@charlie.cs.w LINUX      X86_64 Claimed   Idle     0.000  1965  0+00:00:03
slot4@chevre.cs.wi LINUX      X86_64 Owner     Idle     0.000  1945  0+01:20:31

which is infelicitous. The problem is that the server-side classad attribute projection is only sending to the client the "Name" attribute, which is what condor_status displays, but condor_status sorts based on "Machine", if available. Forcing the projection code to also send the "Machine" attribute will fix the problem.
